Package ohos.usb

Class USBDevicePipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.usb.USBDevicePipe

  • public class USBDevicePipe
extends Object
    Provides methods for transferring data and control messages between USB devices.

    Applications can get device descriptors from USBDevice to operate the USB devices.

    Since:
    5
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Usb#USB_MANAGER

    • Method Detail

      • bulkTransfer

        public int bulkTransfer​(USBEndpoint epObj,
                        byte[] buffer,
                        int length,
                        int timeout)
        Performs bulk data transfer on a specified endpoint.
        Parameters:
        epObj - the endpoint instance.
        buffer - Indicates the buffer for bulk data transfer.
        length - Indicates the length of the data to transfer.
        timeout - Indicates the transfer timeout period, in millisecond. The value 0 indicates that the transfer never times out.
        Returns:
        Returns a value greater than or equal to 0 if the data transfer is successful; returns a negative value otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • bulkTransfer

        public int bulkTransfer​(USBEndpoint epObj,
                        byte[] buffer,
                        int offset,
                        int length,
                        int timeout)
        Performs bulk data transfer on a specified endpoint.
        Parameters:
        epObj - the endpoint instance.
        buffer - Indicates the buffer for bulk data transfer.
        offset - Indicates the offset from first byte in the buffer.
        length - Indicates the length of the data to transfer.
        timeout - Indicates the transfer timeout period, in millisecond. The value 0 indicates that the transfer never times out.
        Returns:
        Returns a value greater than or equal to 0 if the data transfer is successful; returns a negative value otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • claimInterface

        public boolean claimInterface​(USBInterface interfaceObj,
                              boolean force)
        Claims that a specified interface is exclusively occupied. This must be done before transferring data to the endpoint of the interfaceObj interface.
        Parameters:
        interfaceObj - Indicates the interface to be exclusively occupied.
        force - Indicates whether the kernel driver is disconnected. The value true indicates that the kernel driver is disconnected. The value false indicates that the kernel driver is connected
        Returns:
        Returns true if the claim is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • close

        public void close​()
        Closes the USBDevicePipeAdapter.

      • controlTransfer

        public int controlTransfer​(int requestType,
                           int request,
                           int value,
                           int index,
                           byte[] buffer,
                           int offset,
                           int length,
                           int timeout)
        Performs control message transfer on endpoint zero.
        Parameters:
        requestType - Indicates the type of request initiated for control message transfer. For details, see USB protocol specifications. If the most significant bit is 1, data is written from the host. If the most significant bit is 0, data is written into the host.
        request - Indicates the request ID.
        value - Indicates the value of the transfer.
        index - Indicates the index of the transfer.
        buffer - Indicates the buffer from which data is to be transferred.
        offset - Indicates the offset address starting from 0 in the data buffer.
        length - Indicates the length of the data to transfer.
        timeout - Indicates the transfer timeout period, in millisecond.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of bytes transferred; returns 0 if the transfer fails.
        Since:
        5

      • controlTransfer

        public int controlTransfer​(int requestType,
                           int request,
                           int value,
                           int index,
                           byte[] buffer,
                           int length,
                           int timeout)
        Performs control message transfer on endpoint zero.
        Parameters:
        requestType - Indicates the type of request initiated for control message transfer. For details, see USB protocol specifications. If the most significant bit is 1, data is written from the host. If the most significant bit is 0, data is written into the host.
        request - Indicates the request ID.
        value - Indicates the value of the transfer.
        index - Indicates the index of the transfer.
        buffer - Indicates the buffer from which data is to be transferred.
        length - Indicates the length of the data to transfer.
        timeout - Indicates the transfer timeout period, in millisecond.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of bytes transferred; returns 0 if the transfer fails.
        Since:
        5

      • releaseInterface

        public boolean releaseInterface​(USBInterface interfaceObj)
        Claims that a specified interface is released.
        Parameters:
        interfaceObj - Indicates the interface to release.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the release is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • requestWait

        public USBRequest requestWait​(long timeout)
                       throws TimeoutException
        Waits for the result returned by the USBRequest.queue(java.nio.ByteBuffer) method. This is an asynchronous method call. If the operation times out, a timeout exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Indicates the timeout period, in milliseconds. The value 0 indicates no waiting.
        Returns:
        Returns a USBRequest object.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - Throws this exception if the specified timeout elapses.
        Since:
        5

      • requestWait

        public USBRequest requestWait​()
        Waits for the result returned by the USBRequest.queue(java.nio.ByteBuffer) method.
        Returns:
        Returns a USBRequest object.
        Since:
        5

        Parameters:
        config - The config instance.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

        public boolean setInterface​(USBInterface interfaceObj)

      • openByInt

        public boolean openByInt​(String name,
                         int fd)
        Performs an open process on the file descriptor.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the device name.
        fd - Indicates the file descriptor of the device connection.
        Returns:
        Returns the result of the open process.
